entry.def: If you describe someone or something as feeble, you mean that they are weak.

example.ex: He told them he was old and feeble and was not able to walk so far...
example.tran: 他告诉他们，他年老体弱，不能走那么远。

example.ex: the feeble light of a tin lamp.

entry.def: If you describe someone as feeble, you are criticizing them because they are afraid of taking strong action or seem to make no effort.

example.ex: He said that the Government had been feeble.

example.tran: 一些相当软弱的传统主义者

entry.def: If you describe something that someone says as feeble, you mean that it is not very good or convincing.

example.ex: This is a particularly feeble argument.
example.tran: 这个论点尤其站不住脚。

means.word_mean: 1. in a faint and feeble manner;

sentences.sentence: "the lighthouse, flashing feebly against the sleet-blurred, rocky backdrop of the coast of north west Norway"

means.word_mean: 2. in a halting and feeble manner;

sentences.sentence: "reform, in fact, is, rather feebly, on the win"
